body:
Comment 2 by **jesse9jones**: 
Well it doesn't prevent anything but it does make life more difficult. For example, I
have a sort of minimal IDE that can build stuff using various tools (make, waf, etc). It
shows stderr in red so it's easy to spot errors and it greps stderr to automatically
goto error locations generated by various tools (usually compilers).

Neither of these work well with go: errors are not in red and errors don't go to stderr
so I have to grovel through *all* of the output of make just to find go errors. I'd
rather not remember all of stdout just to find go errors...

For now I'm being really lame and if a stdout line includes ".go:" I append it to the
stderr results I grovel through.
